meanings.definition: To compose or write (a literary work)
meanings.sent1: She will endite a beautiful poem for the school play.
meanings.sent2: The author will endite a thrilling novel over the summer.
meanings.sent3: He tried to endite a love letter, but it turned out to be a funny story instead.
meanings.sent4: Her words endite a vivid picture of the sunset in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The songwriter's lyrics endite strong emotions in the listeners.

meanings.definition: To dictate or recite (something) for another to write
meanings.sent1: The teacher will endite the instructions for the students to follow.
meanings.sent2: He endites the speech for his assistant to type up later.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to endite a message, but it came out all jumbled.
meanings.sent4: His words endite a clear path for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The leader endites his vision for the team to execute.

meanings.definition: To put into writing or record
meanings.sent1: She will endite the meeting minutes for everyone to review.
meanings.sent2: The journalist endites the breaking news as it happens.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to endite the suspect's alibi, but it kept changing.
meanings.sent4: His diary endites the daily events of his life.
meanings.sent5: The historian endites the past to preserve it for future generations.
